bibl.title: Letter from Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, July 20, 1909

div1.p: Ida Kissinger thanks Kelly for the photograph of his family. John Kissinger's health is improving.

div1.head: Letter from Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, July 20, 1909
div1.opener:
ans
6 8 09
Kissinger
South Bend Ind July 20th 09 810 Milton Ave.
Dear Dr Kelly
div1.p:
your letter and
pictures of your dear family
are so nice and we appreciate
them greatly you have a lovely
family your wife looks so young
to be a mother to those girls its
certainly a family to be proud of
such sturdy nice boys'. I my
self am partial to boys'. I love
them all, but the little boys' have
been my choice. we would love
to see your family, you said
you were going on your vacation
we are glad you can go and we
of all others wish you pleasure
and good health and rest. which
you surely need. I did not neglect
writing we were called in the Country
Mr. Kissingers Sister had a Sun Stroke
last tuesday week and she is very
poorly over it.

Mr. Kissinger is feeling real well
at present and Sends only his best
regards to you.

with best Wishes and Kindest Regards
to your self and family. let us hear
from you at your convenience
